profile.text: Camp 6 is a prison building located at the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. It previously held al-Qaida suspects^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. As of February 2025, 53 Venezuelan migrants were being held in Camp 6 and guarded by military personnel^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The facility is reportedly in disrepair, with broken showers, doors, and other faulty equipment^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Only two ICE officials were reportedly working inside Camp 6 at the time^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The prison building has 176 cells but a capacity for only 144 men^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Detainees are being fed prepackaged military rations known as MREs^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Luis Alberto Castillo Rivera and Tilso Ramon Gomez Lugo, two of the migrants detained at Guantanamo Bay, were being held in Camp 6^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Cuba is the location of the U.S. military base at Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461], where the Trump administration sent dozens of Venezuelan migrants^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. As of Tuesday, ICE had sent a total of 98 men to Guantánamo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. 53 of these migrants were being held in Camp 6 and guarded by the military^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461], while the other 45 were held in a lower-security building guarded by the Coast Guard^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The U.S. Southern Command has been streaming staff and support personnel to the base since January 29^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The government is reportedly creating a legal black hole on an island in Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: El Paso, Texas, is mentioned as the location from which ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) sent flights containing migrants to the Navy base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. As of Tuesday, a total of 98 men had been sent from El Paso to Guantánamo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: GUANTANAMO BAY NAVY BASE is a U.S. Navy base located in Cuba^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. It houses a terror-detention center^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. In addition to the Pentagon's Guantanamo prison known as Camp Delta, the CIA reportedly operated two secret prisons, or black sites, at Guantanamo in 2003 and 2004, code-named Maroon and Indigo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. These sites were allegedly removed in April 2004 due to concerns about detainees gaining legal representation^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The alleged 9/11 conspirators and other "high-value detainees" were transferred to military detention at Guantanamo in September 2006 after being held in secret CIA custody for three to four years^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Ramzi bin al Shibh, a 9/11 defendant, was reportedly held at Guantanamo earlier^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Rita Radostitz, a lawyer for Khalid Sheik Mohammed, claimed that Gina Haspel ran a secret CIA outpost at Guantanamo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Former FBI agent Ali Soufan stated that during his time at Guantanamo, the CIA’s chief of base “was a man”^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Guantánamo Bay is a U.S. military base located in southeast Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Trump administration sent dozens of Venezuelan migrants to the base^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. These migrants are being guarded by troops rather than civilian immigration officers^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The government has periodically taken migrants picked up at sea to Guantánamo to be processed^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. As of Tuesday, ICE had sent a total of 98 men to Guantánamo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. 53 of these men were being held in Camp 6 and guarded by the military^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The other 45 migrants were being held in a lower-security building on the other side of the base and guarded by members of the Coast Guard^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The U.S. Southern Command operates the terrorism prison and has been streaming staff and support personnel to the base since Trump's order on Jan. 29^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Camp 6, a prison building where al-Qaida suspects were previously held, is reportedly in disrepair^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Supreme Court has ruled that the government has lawful authority to hold al-Qaida suspects in indefinite wartime detention at Guantánamo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Miami is a city that serves as the dateline for the article^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461], indicating the origin of the news report.

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Texas is a state within the United States from which Venezuelan migrants were detained before being sent to Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The first group of 10 men sent to Guantánamo Bay originated from detention in Texas^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. As of Tuesday, ICE had sent a total of 98 men to Guantánamo, according to people keeping track of flights from El Paso, Texas, to the Navy base in southeast Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The United States is the location from which the Trump administration sent dozens of Venezuelan migrants to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The government is described as moving people it intends to deport from *U.S. soil* into incommunicado detention at an offshore prison^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. According to Tricia McLaughlin, a homeland security spokesperson, the agency considered these individuals to have "committed a crime by entering the United States illegally"^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. However, not all migrants in ICE detention entered the United States illegally; some requested asylum at the border but were rejected^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The government has not previously taken people who were already detained on *U.S. soil* to a U.S. detention facility abroad^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. President Donald Trump has called the would-be deportees "criminal aliens"^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The U.S. Southern Command operates the terrorism prison at Guantanamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. A group of legal aid organizations sued the Trump administration, asking that migrants who had been taken to Guantánamo Bay be given access to lawyers to challenge their detention there^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Supreme Court has ruled that the government has lawful authority to hold al-Qaida suspects in indefinite wartime detention at Guantánamo, under a law passed by Congress that authorizes the use of military force against the perpetrators of the Sept. 11 attacks^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. It is not clear what legal authority the Trump administration has to hold people arrested in the United States at Guantánamo for immigration detention purposes^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Venezuela is a South American country from which migrants have been sent by the Trump administration to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Venezuelans in ICE custody have been difficult to deport in recent years due to a breakdown in diplomatic relations^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. However, Venezuela sent two flights to pick up some of its citizens who were being deported this week^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
